intro: Eupatorium hilarii, commonly known as the Hawaiian feverfew, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in coastal habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eupatorium hilarii is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
